verbose_text: MiR-9 is involved in the immune response by fine tuning the expression of a key member of the NF-kappaB family in monocytes and polymorphonuclear neutrophils while the expression of miR-155 is increased during inflammation and has been implicated in macrophage polarization, where miR-155 modulates the switch between pro inflammatory M1 and anti-inflammatory M2 phenotypes.
